text: The Battle of Sluys (; ; 1340) was an early and important naval battle of the Hundred Years' War. The English attacked near the port of Sluis and destroyed most of the French fleet. This made it impossible for France to invade England. Nearly all the fighting afterward took place on land in France. ==Sources== Sluys Sluys Category:1340 Category:1340s in England Category:1340s in France Category:Zeeland
title: Battle of Sluys
